annotation.spannedText: Some people who are vaccinated against chickenpox may still get the disease

classMention.mentionClass: Some people who are vaccinated against chickenpox may still get the disease

annotation.spannedText: it is usually milder with fewer skin blisters and little or no fever

classMention.mentionClass: it is usually milder with fewer skin blisters and little or no fever

annotation.spannedText: Getting chickenpox vaccine is much safer than getting chickenpox disease

classMention.mentionClass: Getting chickenpox vaccine is much safer than getting chickenpox disease

annotation.spannedText: People 13 years or older (who have never had chickenpox and never received chickenpox vaccine) should get two doses at least 28 days apart

classMention.mentionClass: People 13 years or older (who have never had chickenpox and never received chickenpox vaccine) should get two doses at least 28 days apart

annotation.spannedText: However, pregnant women should wait to get the chickenpox vaccine until after they have given birth

classMention.mentionClass: However, pregnant women should wait to get the chickenpox vaccine until after they have given birth

annotation.spannedText: Women should not get pregnant for 1 month after getting the chickenpox vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Women should not get pregnant for 1 month after getting the chickenpox vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Find out if you should be vaccinated before you travel abroad
